verses.verse: Press on towards love, and desire spiritual [gifts] especially that you may prophesy.
For he who speaks in an unknown language is not speaking to men but to God, for no one understands him, because he speaks by the Spirit things not known before.
But he who prophesies speaks to people for edification, exhortation, and comfort.
He who speaks in an unknown language edifies himself, but he who prophesies edifies the congregation.

Would that you all spoke in tongues but better yet that you prophesied, for greater is he who prophesies than he who speaks with tongues unless he interprets so that the congregation would receive edifying.
Now, brothers, if I come to you speaking in an unknown language, how can I help you unless I will speak to you some revelation, knowledge, prophesy, or doctrine.
And even lifeless things produce sound whether flute or harp, but unless they give different tones, how will it be recognized what is played by flute or harp?
And likewise if the trumpet give indistinct tones, who will prepare himself for battle.
So in the same way, unless you talk through language easily understood words, how will anyone understand what is spoken? You might as well speak into the air.
There are, for example, many kinds of sounds in the world and none of them are without meaning.
Therefore if I don't know what the sound means, I will be a foreigner to the speaker and the speaker will be a foreigner to me.
And so you (since you are so desirous for spiritual gifts) seek, so that you may use it to the fullest for edifying the congregation.
So then let him who speaks in an unknown language, pray that he may interpret.
For if I pray in an unknown language, my spirit prays but my understanding is unfruitful.
So what is best? I will pray with the spirit, and I will pray with the understanding, too. I will sing with the spirit, and I will sing with the understanding, too.
So when you give the blessing with your spirit, how will he who is in the position of being unlearned say "Amen" at your giving of thanks, seeing he doesn't understand what you are saying?
For you truly and properly give thanks, but the other is not edified.
I thank my God; I speak with unknown languages more than all of you.
Yet in the congregation I would rather speak five words with my understanding that I can teach others, too, than ten thousand words in an unknown language.
Brothers, don't be childish in understanding. Concerning evil be children; concerning understanding be adults.
It is written in the law, "With [people] of other languages and lips of strangers will I speak to this people, and yet for all that they will not listen to me, says the Lord."
So then unknown languages are a sign to those who don't believe, not to those who believe, but prophesying is for those who believe, not for those who don't believe.
Therefore if the whole congregation is gathered in one place and all speak in unknown languages, and some come in who are unlearned or unbelievers won't they say you are insane?
But if all prophesy and one who doesn't believe comes in or one unlearned, he is convicted by all and is judged by all.
And so in this way the secrets of his heart are revealed, and as a result kneeling face down he will worship God and tell others that God is truly among you.
So how is it, brethren, when you come together everyone has a psalm, teaching, unknown language, or interpretation [of it]. Let everything be for edifying.
If any one speaks in an unknown language, let it be by two or at the most three and then in order, also someone must interpret.
But if there is no interpreter, then he must be quiet in the meeting; let him speak to himself and God.
Let two or three prophets speak and let the others judge.
If something is revealed to another sitting near, let the first stop talking.
For you all can prophesy one after another, so that all may learn and may all be comforted.
The spirits of the prophets are under the control of the prophets, [33] for God is not the [instigator] of confusion but of peace, as in all congregations of God's people.
Let your women remain silent in the congregations, for it is not allowed for them to speak but to be submissive as even The Law states.
If they want to learn any thing let them ask their husbands at home, for it is shameful for women to speak in the congregation.
What! Did the word of God come from you, or do you think it came to only you?
If any man thinks of himself as a prophet or spiritual man, then let him acknowledge that what I write you are the Lord's commandments.
But if any one doesn't understand, let him stay ignorant.
Therefore, brothers, strongly desire to prophesy, but don't forbid speaking in unknown languages.
Let everything be done decently and in order.
